articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets New South African Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets New South African Ambassador 
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Bheki Winston Joshua Langa, South African ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday. 
					 Present there were Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Pak Kil Yon and staff members of the South African embassy. 
					
					 After receiving the credentials Kim had a talk with the ambassador.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Greets FM of Niger
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Greets FM of Niger 
Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- Pak Ui Chun, minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK, Wednesday sent a congratulatory message to Mohamed Bazoum on his appointment as foreign minister of Niger. 
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would steadily grow strong, the message wished him success in his new job.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets German Guest
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets German Guest 
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, had a friendly talk with Stefan Muller, chairman of the German-Korean Parliamentary Friendship Group who paid a courtesy call on him, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.
					 Present there were Ri Jong Hyok, chairman of the DPRK-German Parliamentary Friendship Group, and Gerhard Thiedemann, German ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Foreign Guests Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- Stefan Muller, chairman of the German-Korean Parliamentary Friendship Group, and other foreign guests visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Thursday to pay homage to President Kim Il Sung. 
					 They made bows in boundless reverence to the President who made undying contribution to global independence and the development of friendly relations among countries. 
					
					 They made entries in the visitor's book.

articles.title: New Inventions Applied to Huichon Power Station Project
articles.content:
New Inventions Applied to Huichon Power Station Project
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- New inventions have been made to accelerate the construction of the Huichon Power Station in the northern part of Korea.
					 A newly developed admixture makes concrete coagulate within ten minutes, speeding up concrete tamping.
					
					 A method of using expansive cement raises the project speed considerably.
					
					 A high-speed grinding mixer economizes cement by ensuring the mixture ratio in a proper way.

articles.title: Entertainment Facilities Modernized
articles.content:
Entertainment Facilities Modernized
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- Recreation grounds, parks, theaters and many other entertainment facilities have been constructed or reconstructed throughout the DPRK in recent years.
					 Mt. Myohyang has more climbing routes and pavilions and the Hyangsan Hotel was reconstructed. In the Majon Recreation Ground, a hotel was built and the bathing resort improved.
					
					 A road, tens of kilometers long, leading to Mt. Jangsu in South Hwanghae Province appeared and climbing paths and bridges came into being in the mountain.
					
					 The Ryongaksan, Paekunsan, Sokam, Songdowon and Waudo pleasure grounds have undergone a facelift.
					
					 The light-decorated Kaeson Youth Park has modern amusement and service facilities.
					
					 A funfair was built on the banks of the Jangja River in Kanggye City.
					
					 The Central Zoo in Pyongyang has been reconstructed to help visitors enjoy animals from other countries in natural circumstances. The zoo has a  well-equipped veterinary hospital.
					
					 Among the newly built or reconstructed theaters and cinemas throughout the country are the State Theatre, Pyongyang Grand Theater, North Hwanghae Provincial Art Theater, Songdowon Youth Open-Air Theater and Taedongmun Cinema.

articles.title: Folk Street in Sariwon City
articles.content:
Folk Street in Sariwon City
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- The folk street in Sariwon City, North Hwanghae Province, is always crowed with people. 
					 The street serves as a reminder of the country's time-honored history and culture.
					
					 Seen in the street are models of cultural heritages like those of dolmen and Chomsongdae (astronomical observatory).
					
					 Available in the street are amusements like yut-game, paduk (go) and janggi (Korean chess).
					
					 The street has a Korean dress shop and restaurants serving folk dishes, including glutinous rice-cake and pancake.

articles.title: Guidelines for National Liberation
articles.content:
Guidelines for National Liberation
						
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- It is a clear truth and lesson taught by history that national unity leads to victory and split-up to ruin.
					 When launching the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, President Kim Il Sung regarded the unity of the whole nation as an essential prerequisite to achieving the independence of the country. 
					
					 He raised the issue of an anti-Japanese national united front as an important way for the victory of the Korean revolution at the Kalun meeting held in Juche 19 (1930) and put forward a policy for forming a standing organization for the united front at the Nanhutou meeting in 1936.
					
					 After drawing up the programme and rules of the Association for the Restoration of the Fatherland (ARF) and its inaugural declaration, he convened a meeting of military and political cadres of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army (KPRA) in Tongjiang, Fusong County, in May 1936.
					
					 At the meeting he called for rallying the whole nation as a political force for national liberation and advancing KPRA units into border areas and the homeland to invigorate the anti-Japanese united front movement.
					
					 He was elected ARF chairman at the meeting in conformity with the unanimous will of the Korean people. 
					
					 ARF was the first standing organization embracing all anti-Japanese patriotic forces in Korea.
					
					 The underground organization put the anti-Japanese movement on a higher level and helped move up the day of national liberation based on the concerted effort of all the Korean people.
					
					 The President's idea of great national unity, a treasure of the Korean nation, serves as solid foundations for the reunification of the country.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Long Journey for National Prosperity
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Long Journey for National Prosperity
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- In his lifetime President Kim Il Sung always worked hard for the prosperity of the nation and happiness of the people.
					 On May 5, Juche 81 (1992) he left Pyongyang for Kaesong City early in the morning.
					
					 When the cars carrying him and accompanying officials reached the vicinity of the city at about seven, he suggested taking breakfast there.
					
					 The officials were surprised by his suggestion as they failed to prepare something to eat. But the President had food boxes prepared last night for breakfast to save time and refrain from troubling local people.
					
					 After the frugal repast, he arrived in the city and gave field guidance to the work of preserving historic and cultural relics in the morning, looking around the Koryo Museum, Manwoldae (a ruined royal palace), Sonjuk Bridge, monument to Jong Mong Ju's loyalty to the king, and Mausoleum of King Wang Kon. 
					
					 In the afternoon he inspected economic establishments, including the Kaesong Textile Mill and Pakyon Co-op Farm, and left the city in the evening.
					
					 That day he made a journey as long as more than 440 kilometers.

articles.title: Anniversary of Work of Kim Jong Il Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Work of Kim Jong Il Observed
Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today dedicates a signed article to the 20th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Our Socialism Centred on the Masses Shall Not Perish".
					  The work, published on May 5, Juche 80 (1991), comprehensively clarifies the idea that socialism in the DPRK is one centred on the popular masses, guided by the great Juche idea, the advantages and vitality of Korean-style socialism fully displayed in all fabrics of social life and the solidity and invincibility of the socialist society in which the leader, the party and the masses are single-mindedly united. 
					
					 The past two decades since the publication of the work are shining as a brilliant history in which the invincibility of Korean-style socialism has been fully demonstrated under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 Korean-style socialism dignified thanks to Juche and powerful thanks to Songun has made more dynamic advances since the historic Conference of the Workers' Party of Korea, demonstrating ever-increasing viability. The cause of Korean-style socialism centred on the popular masses started by President Kim Il Sung is shedding its rays as an invincible cause having a rosy prospect of certain victory. This reality is the fruition of the wise leadership of the experienced and tested WPK.
					
					 Korean-style socialism is invincible as it takes the Juche idea as its steadfast guidelines, the popular masses regard socialism as the life and soul and it takes the single-minded unity of the leader, the party and the masses as a cornerstone.
					
					 Rosy is the future of Korean-style socialism centred on the masses advancing under the leadership of the great party and it will always emerge victorious in the future, too.

articles.title: S. Korean Internet Newspaper on Possible Sinking of "Cheonan" by Submarine
articles.content:
S. Korean Internet Newspaper on Possible Sinking of "Cheonan" by Submarine 
						
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- A netizen said that the warship "Cheonan" might have sunk due to its clash with a submarine, according to the south Korean Internet newspaper Jaju Minbo on May 2.
					 In an article titled "The mystery about the animation file showing warship 'Cheonan'" he wrote that the results of an analysis of the animation file on the sinking of the warship shown to foreigners by the Ministry of Defense led to the discovery of something rising between the bow and stern of the broken warship two minutes after the clash. 
					
					 He held that the above-mentioned thing was not a thing floating as claimed by the ministry but a huge thing and the fact that it was moving against the flow of the sea water clearly suggested it had a powerful engine. 
					
					 Conveying this fact, the newspaper said:  It was such animation file that it could clearly confirm the following scenes: When this thing rose to the surface for a while, some of its huge black body was seen on the surface and, at the same time, both the bow and stern of the warship were seen terribly shaking. 
					
					 It is only the submarine that has its mast, its huge part remaining under water and a powerful engine. There is an increasing possibility that the warship was sunk due to its clash with the submarine.

articles.title: S. Korea Accused of Its Sycophantic Behavior towards Japan
articles.content:
S. Korea Accused of Its Sycophantic Behavior towards Japan 
						
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea published a commentary on May 2 accusing the puppet group of traitors for its sycophantic behavior towards Japan. 
					  The commentary recalled that the "government" submitted to an international organization a nonsensical proposal for marking the sea between Korea and Japan as the East Sea of Korea and "Sea of Japan" simultaneously.
					
					 When the "government" came under fire for this, it talked about "a primary strategy" and the like in a bid to pull the wool over the eyes of people, the commentary noted, and continued:
					
					 The authorities have connived at Japan's undisguised ambition to grab Tok Islets, talking about "calm diplomacy" in the relations with it, and now have brought to light their pro-Japan sycophantic nature. 
					
					 It urged the authorities to immediately give up their behavior little short of abandoning the islets, apologize to the people and stop the humiliating diplomacy, though belatedly.

articles.title: S. Korea under Fire for Evading Responsibility for Joblessness of Youth
articles.content:
S. Korea under Fire for Evading Responsibility for Joblessness of Youth
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- The Preparatory Committee of the "Job and Rights to Youth! Youth Joint Action" of south Korea at a press conference on May 1 condemned the puppet authorities for evading the responsibility for the serious joblessness of youth.
					 A press release read out at the conference accused the minister of Employment and Labor of talking nonsense that the joblessness is serious among young people because there are too many young people who majored in literature, history and philosophy.
					
					 This is nothing but rhetoric intended to pass the buck for the young joblessness, the worst in history, on the young people, a clear indication of the irresponsibility and incompetency on the part of the "government" bureaucrats, pointed out the press release.
					
					 Declaring that the organization would carry on the joint actions for the guarantee of the rights of the youth, it demanded the authorities immediately fire the said minister and take measures for the settlement of the issue of young unemployment.

articles.title: S. Korean Civic Organizations Call for Punishing Treacherous Regime
articles.content:
S. Korean Civic Organizations Call for Punishing Treacherous Regime
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- South Korean civic organizations including the Citizens' Solidarity for Democratic Society held a meeting in Seoul on May 2 on the lapse of three years since the candlelight action against the American beef import, according to south Korean CBS. 
					 Three years ago the present regime repeatedly made "apologies" and "reflections" afraid of the citizens' candlelight action, but now it has become more brutal in oppressing people, they held. 
					
					 The regime might have realized what mindset the people had through the recent by-elections, in particular, but it made no word of reflection, they deplored, urging it to resign. 
					
					 They stressed that citizens would hold up candlelights again and turn out in the action to punish the unpopular and undemocratic regime.

articles.title: Settlement of Issue of Registration Fee Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Settlement of Issue of Registration Fee Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Federation of University Students in the 21st Century held a press conference in Seoul on Sunday demanding the puppet authorities immediately settle the issue of university registration fee.
					 Speakers said at the press conference that most students are now subject to temporary absence from school and extra-mural labor due to the high registration fee.
					
					 But the present regime is keen on committing violence against students and arresting them for opposing registration fee hike, turning its face away from such situation, they charged.
					
					 They demanded the regime fulfil its commitment to half the registration fee as early as possible.
					
					 At the end of the conference, the chairmen of the general student councils of various universities had their hair close-cut in protest against the puppet authorities.
					
					 Then students staged a demonstration in demand of an interview with the chief executive.

articles.title: DPRK Army Day Celebrated in Brazil and UK
articles.content:
DPRK Army Day Celebrated in Brazil and UK
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- A meeting and a film show took place in Brazil and a film show in UK on April 23 and 27 to mark the 79th founding anniversary of the Korean People's Army.
					 The participants in the shows watched Korean films "Pyongyang Today" and "Reply of Korea".
					
					 The mayor of Jardinopolis City, Santa Catarina State of Brazil said that all the successes made in army building and the building of a thriving nation in the DPRK would have been unthinkable without the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Il. We wish the Korean people greater success in their efforts to build a thriving nation, he added.
					
					The director for culture of the city noted with high appreciation that President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il devoted their all to the Korean revolution and global independence.
					
					 The Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il serves as a lifeline that defends the sovereignty of the nation and guarantees successes in all fields of the DPRK, he said.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korean People's Army Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korean People's Army Marked Abroad
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- A regional organization and political parties and organizations of Brazil and Nigeria posted special write-ups on their Internet websites between April 16 and 22 to mark the 79th birthday of the Korean People's Army.
					The International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions posted a photo of General Secretary Kim Jong Il and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk and an article titled "Reliable center for training the successors to the revolution" introducing Mangyongdae Revolutionary School.
					
					 The article noted that President Kim Il Sung developed the school into a base for training commanding officers, the core of the revolutionary armed forces.
					
					 The Communist Party of Brazil posted an article titled "People's Korea celebrates the birthday of its people's army", which said that the KPA has become not only the defender of the country and the nation but also the political forces steering the socialist cause. 
					
					 The Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK posted an article with a photo of KPA parade ranks, which said: In the course of overcoming serious economic difficulties in the revolutionary soldier spirit the Korean people became further convinced that they can successfully stand any ordeal and trial and surely emerge victorious when they devotedly follow their leader and breathe and act in his idea and intention with confidence in their strength. 
					
					 The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, in an article titled "Invincible KPA", told about the source of the invincible strength of the KPA which has always emerge victorious in the acute showdown with the U.S. and its followers to defend socialism and reliably guarantee the building of a thriving nation.

articles.title: National Seminar on Songun Politics Held in Italy
articles.content:
National Seminar on Songun Politics Held in Italy
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- An Italian national seminar on the Songun politics took place in Rome on April 28 on the occasion of the 79th birthday of the Korean People's Army.
					Displayed in its venue were famous works of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and publications introducing their immortal feats and the Korean people's efforts for building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 Matteo Carbonelli, secretary general of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, made a report under the title of "Independent politics and Songun politics".
					
					 The reporter stressed that the DPRK's Songun politics serves for defending and realizing independence of the country and the nation and reflects the demand and aspiration of the popular masses for independence.
					
					 Different countries and nations of the world are now being trampled down by the imperialists for they have had no strong defence capability, the reporter said, adding: This reality goes to clearly prove how just the DPRK's Songun policy, independent policy, is.
					
					 Bruno Amoroso, deputy director-general of the Society, said at the seminar that the Songun policy enforced in socialist Korea is the most powerful and successful mode of politics in the present times.
					
					 The scientific accuracy and originality of this policy and its great vitality and invincibility would have been unthinkable without the Juche idea recognized as the idea guiding the human cause of independence, he stressed.
					
					 Aldo Bernardini, chairman of the Italian Committee for the Study of the Juche idea, said that under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il the Korean people would certainly build a thriving socialist nation under the banner of Songun while adhering to independence.

articles.title: Russian Paper on Kim Jong Il's Field Guidance
articles.content:
Russian Paper on Kim Jong Il's Field Guidance
Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- The 17th issue of the Russian paper Patriot carried photos of General Secretary Kim Jong Il providing field guidance to various sectors of the national economy and an article titled "Injecting vitality to building of a thriving nation".
					 The article said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il ceaselessly provides field guidance to different parts of the country to translate into reality the desire for building a rich and powerful nation of President Kim Il Sung, the great leader of the Korean people.
					
					 The journey of field guidance traveled by him to inject vitality to the building of a thriving socialist nation is beyond one's imagination.
					
					 This fact alone is enough to get to know how warm his love for the country and the people is.
					
					 Under his wise guidance the cause of building a thriving socialist nation is making brisk headway in the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Foreign Media
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Foreign Media 
Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- Foreign media gave wide publicity to the exploits President Kim Il Sung performed by founding the Association for the Restoration of the Fatherland in the days of the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle and providing historical roots for achieving the great national unity. 
					The Lao News Agency said: The President clarified the issue of the nation from a new angle on the basis of the Juche idea and put forward the original idea of the great national unity in his early years. He laid down the line calling for intensifying an armed struggle and, at the same time, uniting all the anti-Japanese patriotic forces as one in order to defeat the Japanese imperialists and retake the usurped country and wisely led the struggle for its implementation. 
					
					The Bangladeshi Paper Matribumi and the Indian Paper Defense and Humanity referred to the fact that the President founded the Association for the Restoration of the Fatherland on the basis of the idea of the great national unity and that of the united front in May, 1936, adding that its foundation and activities served as a valuable tradition of the great unity of the Korean nation. 
					
					The Guinean Agency of Press and the Iranian paper Kayhan International reported that the association greatly contributed to expanding and developing the anti-Japanese armed struggle. 
					
					The internet homepage of the Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain stressed that the President's idea of the great unity of the nation and great tradition of the revolutionary unity have been carried forward and developed on new higher stage by illustrious commander of Songun Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Works Published in Many Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Works Published in Many Countries
Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- 20 years have passed since the publication of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Our Socialism Centred on the Masses Shall Not Perish".
					 Kim Jong Il published this work on May 5, Juche 80 (1991), providing an immortal landmark for socialist construction and has since given theoretical and practical answers to the questions arising in accomplishing the cause of socialism and the human cause of independence.
					
					His works have been brought out in over 50 languages in more than 190 countries for the last two decades. More than 12,000 seminars, lectures, reading sessions, briefings, etc. have been organized by foreign political parties, organizations and international and regional bodies to study and disseminate them.
					
					 The above-mentioned work was published and issued in more than 20 languages in more than 90 countries.
					
					 The famous works "The Historical Lesson in Building Socialism and the General Line of Our Party" and "On the Fundamentals of Revolutionary Party Building" were published in at least 10 languages including Chinese, English, Russian, French, and Arabic in dozens of countries in several months after the publication of those works.
					
					The famous works authored by Kim Jong Il one after another in the subsequent period include "Abuses of Socialism Are Intolerable", "Socialism Is a Science" and "Giving Priority to Ideological Work Is Essential for Accomplishing Socialism." At least 540,000 copies of those works were brought out in collections of works and pamphlet in 41 languages in the latter half of the 1990s.
					
					 "Socialism Is What Keeps Our People Alive", "On Preserving the Juche Character and National Character of the Revolution and Construction" and other works were published in Russia, Mongolia, Ecuador, New Zealand and many other countries.
					
					 Kim Jong Il also authored famous works on the Songun policy comprehensively systematizing the Songun ideas and theories and clearly indicating the general orientation and strategy for the development of the state in the era of independence. These works were published in at least 100 countries.

articles.title: China Takes Measure for Eradicating False Reports
articles.content:
China Takes Measure for Eradicating False Reports
 Beijing, May 3 (KCNA) -- 71 broadcasting services of China including the Central People's Broadcasting Service in a recent appeal to the officials in the broadcasting field across the country called for thoroughly eradicating false reports.
					 The appeal said that the officials in the broadcasting field should further enhance the social responsibility and mission and ensure the truth, accuracy and objective nature of information and thus raise the masses' confidence in broadcasting service.

articles.title: China Plans to Conduct Educational Campaign against Use of Drug
articles.content:
China Plans to Conduct Educational Campaign against Use of Drug
 Beijing, May 3 (KCNA) -- China plans to conduct a 2011 educational campaign against the use of drug by school youth and children at the schools of various levels.
					 The notice issued in this regard calls on the schools at all levels to conduct special education for preventing the drug use with a clear purpose mainly during school hours and organize weekly information activities for this aim in June.
					
					 The notice also underscores the need to establish a system of cooperation among schools, families and society in a bid to help school youth and children refrain from using drug.

articles.title: State Council of China Calls for Intensified Correction Campaign
articles.content:
State Council of China Calls for Intensified Correction Campaign
						
 Beijing, May 3 (KCNA) -- The General Office of the State Council of China recently conveyed an "executive advice on correction campaign in 2011" to the Correction Office of the State Council.
					 The advice asked for adherence to the principle of people first and governance for the people in establishing the proper attitude toward the government work and the administration and concentrated efforts to settle the salient problems reflecting the mindset of the masses. 
					
					 It also stressed the need to forge closer ties between the party and the government and the people and thus provide sure guarantee for smoothly carrying out the 12th Five-Year Plan and facilitating the admirable and rapid socio-economic development.

articles.title: Military Drill of CPLA Staged
articles.content:
Military Drill of CPLA Staged 
 Beijing, May 3 (KCNA) -- A military drill was staged recently under the simulated conditions of an actual war in a drill base of Lanzhou Military Area of the Chinese People's Liberation Army.
					 A comprehensive inspection was made of the capability of a logistic unit based on IT.
					
					 The aim sought by the military area through the review of the drill was to map out a plan to build a modern logistic unit in all aspects in five years to come and a proposal for its implementation.

articles.title: Iran Calls on UN to Stop Spread of Islamophobia
articles.content:
Iran Calls on UN to Stop Spread of Islamophobia
Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- The deputy ambassador to the United Nations has called on the UN to take measures to counter the spread of Islamophobia.
					 The spread of Islamophobia and insults against Islam will hurt the sentiments of Muslims and violate their basic rights, he said.
					
					 All should respect different cultures and religions, he added.
					
					 He also lambasted an American pastor for burning a copy of Quran.

articles.title: Myanmar Strives for Satellite Communication Development
articles.content:
Myanmar Strives for Satellite Communication Development
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- Myanmar has made a step forward in the development of satellite communication by setting up a central committee and a working committee for launching satellite.
					 The central committee for launching satellite is to lay down policies for the launch of state-operated satellites, approve satellite-launching memorandums of understanding and carry out tasks aimed at obtaining space-related technology.

articles.title: Japanese Protest against US Military Base
articles.content:
Japanese Protest against US Military Base
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- Some 22,000 residents living near the U.S. Kadena Air Base in Okinawa Prefecture of Japan filed a lawsuit with the Naha District Court on April 28 as regards the aircraft noise. 
					 In the file they strongly urged a ban on flights by U.S. warplanes, including nighttime flights, and reparation for damage by noise.

articles.title: Anti-US Demo Staged in Syria
articles.content:
Anti-US Demo Staged in Syria
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- Hundreds of Syrians of different strata staged a demonstration outside the U.S. embassy in Damascus on May 1 to protest against the U.S. interference in Syria's internal affairs. 
					 They strongly urged the U.S. to promptly halt its interference in the country's internal affairs, shouting anti-U.S. slogans and holding flags bearing letters critical of the U.S. human rights abuses in Iraq, Afghanistan and other countries. 
					
					 They also severely condemned the U.S. for patronizing Israel's criminal actions against Palestinians.

articles.title: Piracy in Malacca Strait Drops Significantly
articles.content:
Piracy in Malacca Strait Drops Significantly
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- Piracy in Malacca Strait drops significantly following an intensive joint surveillance by Indonesia, Singapore and Malaysia, Antara News Agency quoted an Indonesian minister as saying on Friday.
					 Defense Minister Purnomo Yusgiantoro said that Indonesia has placed 12 radars across Malacca Strait, from Aceh province to Batam Island of Riau Archipelago province, to monitor ships movement.

articles.title: Quakes Hit Kazakhstan and Taiwan
articles.content:
Quakes Hit Kazakhstan and Taiwan
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- An earthquake measuring 5.5 on the Richter scale jolted Kazakhstan on May 1.
					 The epicenter was 76 km northeast of Almaty.
					
					 The earthquake continued four times. 
					
					 Another quake measuring 5 on the Richter scale jolted Yilan County, Taiwan on April 30.
					
					The epicenter was about 8 km away from the county seat.

articles.title: Volcano Erupts in Ecuador
articles.content:
Volcano Erupts in Ecuador
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- The Tungurahua Volcano erupted in Ecuador on April 29, causing ashes and torrent of lava. 
					 Such measures as emergency evacuation of inhabitants around it were taken in this regard.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il asiste a la inauguración del Centro Deportivo Polivalente
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il asiste a la inauguración del Centro Deportivo Polivalente
Pyongyang, 5 de mayo (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comité de Defensa Nacional de la República Popular Democrática de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejército Popular de Corea, participó en la ceremonia inaugural del Centro Deportivo Polivalente del EPC.
					Este gimnasio moderno con cerca de 10 mil metros cuadros de dimensión arquitectónica facilita todas las condiciones necesarias para entablar y ver los partidos de baloncesto, voleibol, futsal y otros deportes y cuenta con las instalaciones culturales y de servicio público.
					
					El discurso de la ocasión estuvo a cargo del submariscal del EPC Kim Yong Chun, miembro del Buró Político del Comité Central del PTC, vicepresidente del Comité de Defensa Nacional y ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares.
					
					Al ver la parte interna y la externa del centro deportivo de forma elegante y majestuosa, el Dirigente se puso muy contento de que los constructores militares hayan construido en un corto plazo otra grandiosa creación a la altura de la época del Songun, y evaluó altamente sus orgullosos méritos.
					
					Terminada la inauguración, el Dirigente vio con los cuadros acompañantes la competencia inaugural de los equipos deportivos del EPC.
					
					Diciendo que el desarrollo deportivo es muy importante en fortalecer el poderío nacional impulsando exitosamente la lucha revolucionaria y la construcción y en consolidar las relaciones de amistad con varios países del mundo, presentó las tareas programáticas que servirán de directiva para desarrollar rápidamente el deporte nacional.
					
					Le acompañaron en esta ocasión los cuadros directivos de las instituciones del partido y las fuerzas armadas: Kim Jong Un, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Yong Chun, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Kim Kyong Hui, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, Kim Yang Gon, Pak To Chun, Choe Ryong Hae, Thae Jong Su, Kim Phyong Hae, Mun Kyong Dok, U Tong Chuk, Ju Kyu Chang, Kim Chang Sop, Ri Myong Su, los miembros de la Comisión Militar Central del PTC: Kim Kyong Ok, Kim Won Hong, Kim Myong Guk, Jong Myong Do, Ri Pyong Chol, Choe Pu Il y Kim Yong Chol, el jefe de departamento del CDN, Hyon Chol Hae, el ministro de Deportes Pak Myong Chol, los oficiales y soldados del EPC y los deportistas militares.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reúne con nuevo embajador sudafricano
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reúne con nuevo embajador sudafricano
Pyongyang, 5 de mayo (ATCC) -- Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la República Popular Democrática de Corea, recibió el día 5 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae las cartas credenciales de Bheki Winston Joshua Langa, nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la República de Sudáfrica en Corea.
					  En la ocasión estuvieron presentes el vicecanciller coreano Pak Kil Yon y los miembros de la embajada sudafricana.
					
					  Tras recibirlas, Kim departió con el embajador.

articles.title: Aplicadas nuevas invenciones en la obra de Huichon
articles.content:
Aplicadas nuevas invenciones en la obra de Huichon
Pyongyang, 5 de mayo (ATCC) -- Fueron aplicadas nuevas invenciones valiosas en la construcción de la Central Hidroeléctrica de Huichon.
					Una de ellas es el coagulante rápido usado en la construcción del dique, el cual posibilita el endurecimiento de hormigón dentro de 10 minutos asegurando la calidad.
					
					Los constructores redujeron a la mitad el tiempo de inyección del cemento y duplicaron la velocidad de la construcción al introducir nuevo método de inyección del cemento inflado.
					
					Entre tanto, la hormigonera de alta velocidad, inventada nuevamente, asegura en alto nivel la proporción de mezcla ahorrando muchas cantidades de cemento.

articles.title: Construidos y remozados en Corea los establecimientos culturales
articles.content:
Construidos y remozados en Corea los establecimientos culturale
Pyongyang, 5 de mayo (ATCC) -- En los últimos años, se construyeron nuevamente o se reconstruyeron en Corea a la altura del nuevo siglo muchos parques, zonas de recreo, teatros y otras bases de vida cultural. 
					En la zona de recreo del monte Myohyang se construyeron maravillosas vías de alpinismo y miradores y se reedificó el Hotel de Hyangsan. 
					
					En la zona de recreo de Majon se levantó el hotel homónimo y se vieron mejoradas las condiciones de la playa. 
					
					El monte de Ryongak en la ciudad de Pyongyang se ha convertido también en un destino de descanso cultural del pueblo. 
					
					En el monte Jangsu, conocido como el Kumgang de Hwanghae, aparecieron nuevos puentes y rutas de excursión de decenas de kilómetros de largo. 
					
					Además, se han remozado bien las zonas de recreo del monte Paekun, Sokam, Songdowon y Waudo. 
					
					En el Parque Juventud de Kaeson de esta capital parpadean de modo fascinante por la noche las lamparillas decorativas y se instalaron ultramodernos equipos de diversiones y establecimientos de servicio público. 
					
					En la ciudad de Kanggye se construyó el Parque de Atracciones Juventud de Kanggye a las orillas del pintoresco río Jangja. 
					
					Por otra parte, el Parque Zoológico Nacional conserva en ambiente natural muchos animales raros procedentes de diferentes países del mundo y tiene hasta un moderno hospital veterinario. 
					
					Entre tanto, se realizaron en esta capital y otras localidades del país la construcción y la reparación de muchos teatros y cines, específicamente, el Teatro Nacional de Drama, el Gran Teatro de Pyongyang, el Teatro de Arte de la Provincia de Hwanghae del Sur, el Teatro al Aire Libre Juventud de Songdowon y el Cine Taedongmun.
